Description.val:
This budget provides funding for targeted modernization of various HM&E systems on board Amphibious Assault Ships.  Modernization efforts include the procurement and installation of: High Efficiency Small-Capacity (HES-C) Air Conditioning Compressors; various Interior Communications (IC) systems; automated Electric Plant controls and circuit breakers as part of the Power Management Platform (PMP); Brushless Generators for the PMP; main feed pump replacement; steam fire pump replacement; Shipboard Air Traffic Control Communications (SATCC); and Navigation Critical Data System (NCDS/NavCrit).

 HES-C provides additional air conditioning capability to support growing electronic cooling requirements. IC Systems modernization provides up to date IC system installations necessary to maintain critical communications internal to the ships.  Electric Plant controls and circuit breaker installation provides modern electric plant controls as part of the overall PMP to improve survivability and increase electric plant reliability. Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators. Main feed pump procurement and install replaces obsolete main feed pumps for the main propulsion boiler.  Steam driven fire pumps are replaced with variable speed drive (VSD) electric fire pumps eliminating a substantial maintenance driver for the LHA/LHD Class Ships. Additionally, funding supports procurement and installation of SATCC and Navigation Critical Data Distribution (NavCrit) systems in support of capability requirements on Amphibious Assault Ships.

[P40A / Conjunctive HM&E Alterations]: LH002 Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

[P40A / Conjunctive HM&E Alterations]: LH002 Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

Name.val: LH001 - LHD Midlife, Brushless Generator for PMP

Name.@footnote: FY 2016 Brushless Generator installation was cancelled due to technical design problems discovered during the installation planning process.  The ship set procured in FY 2015 is now planned to be installed in FY 2017.    FY 2017 Brushless Generator install cost estimate increased due to a change in the rigging path driven by actual passageway and compartment dimensions captured during the ship check. Additional access cuts and interference removal are required.   The ship set procured in FY 2016 will be installed in the next planned LHD availability, scheduled for FY 2022.

Remarks.val:
Models of Systems Affected: LHD Midlife PMP

The Brushless Generator replacement will reduce down time, total ownership costs, and maintenance costs associated with antiquated brush type generators.

-Five (5) Generators are required to complete a shipset; The FY2015 procurement funding includes one shipset (5 generators) and one additional generator (1 generator) to be used for engineering testing (shock and vibration, etc).
-The FY2016 procurement funding includes only one shipset (5 generators).

Name.@footnote: FY 2016 and FY 2017 funds are required for significant engineering services for Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) improvements, which are required to resolve obsolescence issues in advance of the ship availability start in Q1 FY20.  Funding In FY17 will be used to complete the HES-C Feasibility study, which will include NRE costs for the design of the chiller, production ROM costs, as well as start laying out the interface control document for the chiller that will be required by PY to install.  In FY17 detailed design and production prototype manufacture will begin and anticipates put that unit through full first article testing.

Remarks.val:
Models of Systems Affected: LHD Midlife HVAC

This ship alteration improves the Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) capability for the LHDs as part of the LHD midlife.
Replacement of obsolete main feed pump with new shock qualified unit to meet service life.

Name.@footnote: NAVCRIT must be installed conjunctive with both SSDS MK II and CIC Room Rearrangement SCDs.  Budget/funding must remain aligned across the FYDP.

Remarks.val: The Navigation Critical Distribution System (NCDS) procurements will be installed on LHD Class ships to replace and consolidate current analog Interior Communications (IC) data signals on the MK 70 and IC Switchboards, as well as analog indicators throughout the ships. The removal of the AN/USQ-82(V) Shipboard Data Multiplexer System (SDMS) will also be included. Network switches will be installed to provide data transmission from the NAVSSI Real Time Subsystem (RTS) to all clients and devices that require navigation data. Input Output Controllers (IOC) will be installed to convert the Navigation Sensor System Interface (NAVSSI) Standard Navigation Message from Ethernet to the required analog signal.  Programmable Logic Controllers will be installed to handle all Navigation related alarms. Navigation Displays and Navigation Management Data Terminals (Alarm Panels) will be installed in various locations to provide the NAVCERT required data and alarms in the appropriate locations. A distributed IRIG-B timing architecture is also included, which includes IRIG-B clocks.

Name.val: LH001 - Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Control)

Name.@footnote: Must be installed concurrent with or after Power Management Platform (Brushless Generator).  Switchboard Breaker Replacement and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls) must be installed concurrently.
Name.val: Power Management Platform (Electic Plant Controls) -- Procurement
Power Management Platform (Electic Plant Controls) -- Installation

Remarks.val:
Power Management Platform (PMP) modernization converts legacy controls to a digital automated control system.  This system gathers and combines all Electric plant data so that it is available at any electric plant control station.  PMP simplifies multiple step control sequences into single step operations and makes possible control capabilities that were previously too cumbersome for operators to perform. i.e. Baseload, and Real / Reactive power balancing. PMP implements a gradual Ship Service Turbine Generator (SSTG) turbine startup/shutdown sequence which allows the turbine to achieve stabilized temperatures more consistently, reducing stress on components and contributing to prolonged service life.  System automation reduces electrical system transients and stress on breaker components by employing a Zero Power Transfer (ZPT) strategy, which limits the current flow through an individual breaker to zero during open/close evolutions.  
Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls) must be installed concurrently.  Collectively, these two non-severable modernization efforts provide enhanced electric plant (EP) situational awareness, reliability flexibility, and survivability through replacement of obsolete breakers with breakers currently used in other ship classes and through installation of modern electric plant controls and alarms.  Brushless Generator Install must be accomplished prior to or concurrent with Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls).

Name.@footnote: Must be installed concurrent with or after Power Management Platform (Brushless Generator).   Switchboard Breaker Replacement and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls) must be installed concurrently.

Remarks.val:
Switchboard Breaker Replacement modernizes main switchboard breakers.  Legacy circuit breakers currently utilized on LHD-1 class ships are obsolete, problematic and have a high cost of ownership.  These breakers will be replaced with a unit that is also installed across multiple classes of surface ships. The replacement circuit breakers have a high reliability and low cost of ownership. All generator output, load center and bus tie breakers will be replaced as a part of this modernization. 
Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls) must be installed concurrently.  Collectively, these two non-severable modernizations provide enhanced electric plant (EP) situational awareness, reliability flexibility, and survivability through replacement of obsolete breakers with breakers currently used in other ship Classes and through installation of modern electric plant controls and alarms.  SCD 11159 Brushless Generator Install must be accomplished prior to or concurrent with Switchboard Breaker Upgrade and Power Management Platform (Electric Plant Controls).

Name.@footnote: IVN Modernization, Conference Bridge Modernization (on applicable ships), One Way Announcing System Modernization, and ICT Modernization must be installed concurrently.

Remarks.val: The One Way Announcing System modernization replaces the current obsolete 1/2/3/5/6/10 MC Announcing Systems with a Digital Integrated Announcing System (DIAS) controls and electronics.  Installation of DIAS equipment resolves widespread obsolescence in order to restore announcing capability, and system operational availability, performance, and reliability necessary for support the ship's mission and secure crew safety.

Name.@footnote: IVN Modernization, Conference Bridge Modernization (on applicable ships), One Way Announcing System Modernization, and ICT Modernization must be installed concurrently.

Remarks.val: Integrated Voice Network (IVN) system modernization replaces the existing Ships Service Telephone System (SSTS) aboard LHD 1 through LHD 4 with IVN.  The legacy SSTS is obsolete and unsupported and contains single points of failure.  IVN is a survivable telephony network providing Vital and Tactical internal communications capabilities.  System architecture, end user, and interface configurations will provide commonality with the LHD 8 IVN.

Name.@footnote: IVN Modernization, Conference Bridge Modernization (on applicable ships), One Way Announcing System Modernization, and ICT Modernization must be installed concurrently.

Remarks.val: ICT modernization replaces the obsolete 7300-Series Programmable Integrated Communications Terminals (PICTs) with modern, supported Integrated Communication Terminals (ICT). ICT modernization will align LHD1 - 7 ICT configurations with LHD 8 through additions, deletions and/or one for one replacement to achieve United States Marine Corp (USMC) requirements.

LHD 1 Class HYDRA modernization replaces the out of production P7100/MRK fixed and portable radios with XG-75 radios, replaces obsolete AN/SRC-55 (HYDRA) electronic components, adds vital wireless encrypted communications capability in below deck spaces, and incorporates  the industry standard Association of Public Safety Communications Officials (APCO) P-25 signaling protocol.  The HYDRA Wireless Communication System provides wireless communications capability supporting Flight Deck, Small Boat operations, Damage Control, and Security efforts.  HYDRA modernization will create commonality with equipment installed in the LSD 41/49 class, CG-47 class, and CVN-68 class, as well as new construction including LHA-7, LPD-28, CVN-79 and follow-on hulls.

LHD 1 Class HYDRA modernization replaces the out of production P7100/MRK fixed and portable radios with XG-75 radios, replaces obsolete AN/SRC-55 (HYDRA) electronic components, adds vital wireless encrypted communications capability in below deck spaces, and incorporates  the industry standard Association of Public Safety Communications Officials (APCO) P-25 signaling protocol.  The HYDRA Wireless Communication System provides wireless communications capability supporting Flight Deck, Small Boat operations, Damage Control, and Security efforts.  HYDRA modernization will create commonality with equipment installed in the LSD 41/49 class, CG-47 class, and CVN-68 class, as well as new construction including LHA-7, LPD-28, CVN-79 and follow-on hulls.
